Reviews.Title: “Price good, other things not so good”
Reviews.Author: Pegawil
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed for three nights in March. Because we spent so little time in our rooms, we managed okay, but facilities were very 'average'. A fair bit of mould around shower area, our fridge door seal was broken, therefore ice was protuding out the door and proceeded to melt away from time to time leaving a puddle on the floor. The beds (two single and a sofa bed) were quite hard and uncomfortable. I will be going back to Sydney, but would prefer to pay a little more than our $51 per night per person and stay somewhere a bit more comfortable. We walked into Sydney each day so location was accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Average. Very”
Reviews.Author: Chuckf1966
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the agent who booked this for us in Brisbane got the location wrong.....by about 5km. Staff were pleasant enough, but after arriving in Sydney at 7am and having to wait until after 3pm to check in, we were a little desperate for a shower & a nap. Our room was on the top floor - BE WARNED! There are no lifts! - and it's a bit of a struggle to drag heavy luggage up 3 flights of stairs. The room was clean enough, but we discovered what appeared to be blood on one of the curtains, a cigarette burn in the cover of the futon (this is the second "bed") and after sneezing relentlessly for two days I opened the cover of the a/c unit to find the filters completely blocked with dust. I realise that it's basic, but it would have been nice to have had at least TWO of everything in the cutlery and crockery. One teaspoon was a bit silly. We had a constant battle with cabbies trying to find the place. Apparently none of them speak English, none know how to operate their GPS units and Chalmers St being one-way was a source of constnt confusion. There are better places available for your $ and better located. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tina L
Reviews.Content: we arrived late saturday night with 3 our young kids and loads of luggage. Found out we were on 3rd floor, with no lifts this was hard work!! I was furious to find out they did not have a cot in the room for my 1 yo son, I went down and asked and she basiclly didnt care until i started getting really mad at her that she went to look. She then couldnt find one.. this was AFTER i rang the day before to confirm there would be a cot there!!!! So my son had to sleep on the floor!! Was not impressed. they next day in the afternoon (after I saw them n the morning with one...) they decided to bring one up. Wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: bombshell33
Reviews.Content: My sister booked this hotel for several nights at the start of a family holiday. I was quite dubious about staying here because of some of the reviews I'd read on this site, but it turned out okay. We didn't have any trouble with the reception staff, in fact I found them to be very pleasant. We also didn't have a problem with noisy neighbours or traffic, but that might have been because we were on the ground floor on the city side. The room seemed secure enough, and the air conditioning worked, which is good because the room is smallish, and got very stuffy very quickly. There was a handy kitchenette with a microwave in our room, which made self-catering breakfasts and late dinners doable. Everything in the kitchenette was clean and reasonably well looked after. The room was generally clean, and the beds were very comfortable. I shared a room with my Mum; my sister had another room with her young daughter and our cousins. They were reasonably comfortable, too, and had a small balcony over Chalmers St. The only complaint I would have would be in regards to the bathroom. The shower cubicle wasn't cared for: there were mould stains (possibly still live mould) in the cubicle, and the lime build-up on the shower door was so bad that the door was actually immovable, with the rubber seals being quite rotten, it was a sliding door that wouldn't run on its track. It took 10 minutes of coaxing (forcing!) to get the door to open. That was pretty ridiculous, but as it was after 10pm there wasn't anyone around we could call. The bottom of the shower was stained, and though it was probably cleaner than it looked, was still a bit unpleasant. The hotel is an easy 10 minutes walk from Central Railway, and there are also buses that run along Chalmers St (a bus stop is practically out the front.) There are several places to eat just around the corner in the Cleveland street area, and also at least 2 supermarkets within 10 minutes walk (I don't know what people were complaining about when they said there's nothing close by, I guess they object to having to walk to get their dinners!) Overall, you get what you pay for here. Not a terrible experience at all, and I *might* consider staying here in future if I was with several people and we were all on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “central railway hotel, sydney”
Reviews.Author: xjenniex
Reviews.Content: in August 2011after a long flight from London to Sydney I arrived at the Central Railway Hotel. Name doesnt sound too inspiring but it was a welcome sight. The staff were very helpful. The room had everything you could want for a longer stay (I was only staying a couple of days) i.e. microwave, toaster, kettle, iron and board. Bed was very clean and comfortable and bathroom, although some might think it needed updating was very clean and fine for my needs. The shower was really good and the water very hot. It is situated in an older part of Sydney but not too far from the Opera House and other tourist attractions. There were lots of little Deli shops in the vicinity and bus tickets could be bought from a shop just down the road from the hotel My room was on the ground floor which pleased me as i had heaps of luggage and there was no lift. for anyone staying at this hotel and they buy a bus ticket the bus stop is just across the road from the hotel so that is easy but it is a one way street and unfortunately i fotgot this when returning to the hotel in the evening and got a bit lost. !!!!!!!!! If i stayed in Sydney again i wouldnt hesitate to stay at this hotel again. it's not the Ritz but it is very clean and comfortable and for me that is what matters .

Reviews.Title: “Not an enjoyable experiance”
Reviews.Author: Nickwaddick
Reviews.Content: I have not contributed recently to trip advisor or any other review sites becuase our own opions are so objective however i felt i had to hit the keyboard about this hotel. I had been booked into this for a week at the start of November however only stayed 4 nights and moved to another property. The location is not too bad. It is a short 10 minute walk if that to Central Railway station. There's a woolies about 5 minutes away and a couple of conor stores locally as well, however there is not much else in the area. The area seemed plesent and safe. Check in was not as easy as some. I was told to call the number on the door as i would be arriving late, however when i called i was berated by the manager for calling (8.30pm) and told to ring the bell until the staff on location came to the door, which they did. Some confusion over the pre paid nature of my room when they wanted to charge me for it again however easy enough to sort out. The room itself was quite big, which was nice however my room was number 5 and faced onto the main room and was very noisey all the time. The bed is in a bad location right next to the Window and this made it impossible to sleep well. The bed was very uncomfy and when i finally got the Air con unit working which was directly over the bed, it belched out black soot all over the sheets and continued to do so. There appeared to be no housekeeping. I had a new set of towels placed on the floor of the room by the door on the 3rd day, but no bed service or any other sign of housekeeping (bins etc) however on the 2nd day i started to get eaten alive by something on the bed. I asked for the sheets and Blanket to be changed and by the 4th day i could not take it any more and checked out and found another hotel. The staff seemed very disintrested. It is a shame really but i would not touch it with a bardge pole again. A little bit of money spent doing it up and some new beds and linens would go a long way here. I would really say this is more of an upmarket Backpacker type place then a 3 star hotel, which is fine if your happy with that but for the cost of the room i did expect a little more or at least clean sheets. No Phones in the room and a rather limited choice on the TV as well if you are stuck in the room for any amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “The place grew on me”
Reviews.Author: ruzanna23
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because of the price. There are no lifts in this place (we knew that in advance) and was dismayed that we got a room on the topmost floor. But that's because we had big luggage with us full of shopping from Melbourne. But if you don't have much luggage with you, it should be fine. If you have small kids with strollers, I suggest asking in advance for a room on the ground floor. The room was sorta old but it was clean and the bathroom was pretty big. There was also a kitchen sink and a microwave. I like that they prepared a sponge and dishwashing liquid. There is a small laundrette in the building ($3 each for washer and dryer) but it closes at 8pm. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood, not far from the central station where you can catch buses including the free CBD 555 buses and sightseeing bus. To those not used to walking, they might find it far. But that aside, its very nicely located, easy to find and close to the airport. Taxi from airport to this hotel costs around AUD23 (June 2011). If you are bringing a car, there seemed to be lots of easy parking options around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: andrew.gill
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights in May 2011. I stayed in Room 1 which is a good size, with clean and comfortable double bed, ample storage and a good sized bathroom with great hot shower. The room has a TV, microwave, kettle and crockery and cutlery. Room 1 faces Chalmer Street which can be noisy but ear plugs meant I slept well each night. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad room, however there are no lifts”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy13132008
Reviews.Content: Room was ok, we asked for accomodation for 5, however we were on the third floor, there was no lift and two family members struggled getting up and down stairs with luggage. One of the staff at reception was friendly but the other one was not very very friendly. Price was ok for accomodation for 5 people.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: syd_2001
Reviews.Content: I needed to attend a conference in the Sydney CBD and had to find accommodation which was convenient. After reading comments from previous reviewers I was a bit unsure about this hotel. However, once I had arrived I was able to form my own opinion. Checkin process was smooth and efficient, staff in the reception were extremely courteous and helpful. The price I paid for the accommodation was quite reasonable for Sydney at this time of year. With regards to the quality of the rooms, they were extremely clean and well equiped. I have back problems so often have trouble with sleeping whilst on business, the bed at this hotel was very comfortable particularly after a busy day. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “'Extremely Noisy'”
Reviews.Author: HannahAberdeen
Reviews.Content: On arrival at 5.00pm door locked and so used doorbell with no response. Other patron who arrived phoned the manager to let us in. He advised bell was broken! We noticed that door is locked all the time. Room we had was on first floor and was adjacent to next door's cheap boarding house. Patrons of this place sit outside outside every night directly under the windows of the hotel, making lots of noise until approx 1.30am. Hotel has no way to rectify this, so would not advise that folk stay here if they want any sleep. Also stairs to reach each floor has fire door as exit, and so folk going to each floor bang door shut, this goes on until early hours of the morning also. Hotel is not close to the Railway Station, dont know where they got the name Central Railway Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “central railway ok!”
Reviews.Author: pepiya1999
Reviews.Content: first time in Sydney booked this hotel by internet,rooms are big with tv and bathroom,near central station from which you can visit the city. not very cheap for the room and the service but ok! for me it's better to sleep in bondi!!! rooms with nice balcony,table and chairs!!!! you can have a coffe in room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect too much...”
Reviews.Author: clngada
Reviews.Content: Been there for only one night for my flight back to home. For my case, this hotel is not too far from airport (around 20 minuntes of drive) and walk to Chinatown takes 10-15 mins. Yet, there's some more hotels much near to Central station. So its location not that much of its strenght. I could only say the stay was so-so. Room is quite spacious with simple pantry inside. Yet its cleanliness is just of average, you can see dusty desk, hair on your bed sheet. As for the staff, I can't say they are helpful and there is one housekeeping lady was so rude that she wanted to kick us out of the room one hour before its check out time... If you want to stay near the station with limited budget, I recommend you try other.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, rundown, rude”
Reviews.Author: lilbluehorse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with a child. When we arrived, the check-in experience was plain rude, bordering on abusive. The man kept ignoring us to either walk off, abuse other customers, or answer the phone. I should have realised when others told me they were checking out early, and that his attitude was the norm. Seriously he is in the wrong job if he doesn't like people. I was charged $10 more per night than quoted over the phone. He showed me his scribbled note to 'prove' it was my mistake. The room was up two flights of stairs in what felt like a fire escape. The room smelt damp. The air conditioning sounded like an aeroplane taking off. Shower and kitchen sink taps leaked. Cracked tiles, broken cupboards, blown lightbulbs, filthy blankets, limited crockery/cutlery. Fridge stank of sour milk, and hadn't been defrosted since the 2000 Olympics! No apparent housekeeping. The shower went from boiling hot water to freezing cold (not great when bathing a child!). No face washers - even when requested. Which wouldn't usually bother me, but cleaning a child - they are needed. On the plus side, it wasn't as noisey as warned by exiting guests (street noise), there were ample pillows, great blockout curtains, and it was a convenient location for what we needed (visiting family). Although it is not really 'central' sydney, and is a 10 minute walk from Central Railway Station. For the price, I'd find somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Limited access”
Reviews.Author: haematocrit
Reviews.Content: No disabled access. Steep steps to main entrance and no lift to upper floor. Would be helpful if these points were made clear on web site and advertising. Staff were very helpful and willingly carried our cases upstairs for us on arrival, but we still found stairs difficult to manage when going out in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “The manager was rude, dishonest and intrusive/”
Reviews.Author: RenalRide
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Golden Chain motels around Australia and have always found them to be of top quality and of excellent value. This hotel was an exception, mainly due to the manager. He tried to show potential guests my room and was extremely rude to me when he was 'found out' as he expected me not to be there at the time. The following day, he entered my room on the pretext that he was servicing the air conditioner, when the filth of the air conditioning filter proved that he had not even looked at it. He smoked in the corridor, he berated a number of guests in a loud belligerent voice, and was insulting and intrusive. He should not be managing a hotel. I don;t know how his staff put up with him.

Reviews.Title: “One step above a hostel”
Reviews.Author: wndytraveler
Reviews.Content: The pictures online and reviews gave this establishment a better look than what was the reality. We were dissappointed. Luckily we were out sightseeing the majority of the time and spent little time in the room. The room smelled damp and musty, the bedding was poor and dingy, and the carpet was like outdoor carpet and desperately needed a vaccuum.I would not reccommend this hotel. Spend the extra 10-20 bucks a night for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Alright if you want the basics!”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugfromNZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for a week. It was a typical motel set up, rooms pretty standard and there is a nice patio area we sat for a drink some evenings (no restaruant or bar). The lady at reception (with the English accent) was really nice and helpful. It is about 10 - 15 min walk from the Train (which was quite tiring some days after being on our feet all day) and has stairs out front so be prepared to carry your suitcases up! We were in Sydney to see the sights and were out most of the day so we didnt want a flash hotel, but the lack of cleaning really puts me off staying again! There were hairs on the bathroom floor, rubbish from last guests in the bin and i dont think they cleaned anything the whole week we were there! They didnt vacuum, or clean anything in the bathroom and we had to clean our own dishes (with a grotty old cloth). One day when we returned our balcony door was left wide open from the housekeeper! It was an alright place to stay if you want the basics, but I would have paid a bit more to stay somewhere that gets cleaned often!

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: jonof
Reviews.Content: Were does one start, I picked this hotel for its location & price which in hind sight was really a mistake. On arrival was met by the friendly mangager who showed me to the room after paying in advance for 7 days. after a long flight all one wanted to do was settle in and rest and it wasnt till the next day That I started to find out my mistake. Firstly I got up at 7am to get ready for my bussiness apts for the day to discover for a $100.00 per night you get cold water for the shower & also the shower door was falling apart, after speaking to the manager told to wait for 20 min or till its hot and he would look at the shower door, dont think my bussiness apts would like to wait for me so off to work with no shower. came home that night dropped my classes nelt down to pick them up and found the last customers rubbish still under the bed, better look further and in the ice box was there food as well. The shower door was fixed 3 days later by my self, the house keeping staff did a poor job, forgot to take out rubbish, never cleaned the toilet the entire time I was there, and even forgot to leave fresh towels. Summary bad management, would not stay there again, Pity a good hotel with great protental if run right. Pity I cant get hold of the actual owners.

Reviews.Title: “NOT recommended!”
Reviews.Author: globalfreqtravellers
Reviews.Content: The room was acceptable, a reasonably basic standard room. We reached Sydney early in the morning and we arrived at the hotel two hours before the check-in time. We were tired and wanted to wait at the reception. The female staff in the reception was helpful and professional, she had arranged for the room to be ready slightly earlier than the normal check-in time. As we stayed, the linens and towels were not changed daily and when we requested them to be changed after 3 days, the manager however, was rude and unpleasant. He mentioned that linens and towels would not be changed often because we'd been given lower rate as we would stay for few weeks. We understand that we could not expect much in a low budget hotel. However, as a manager of a hotel/motel in a hospitality industry, he had shown low professionalism and had made our stay less enjoyable. Overall, I will not be coming back and will not be recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Single room a rip off and service is disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Schnapper1
Reviews.Content: I suspect that my room started off as a closet or storage space which then had a bathroom added on to it. I booked a single room through Wotif, the description said that the room was small however that was a gross exaggeration. It is no more than 175cm or 5ft 9in wide, I am a little taller than that and when my head touched one wall I could not fully extend my legs (I lay on the floor to measure the room). The only way I could lay on the bed was to prop up one side with a sheet folded four times but this was still not enough so I had to fold a bath toweI four times to put under the mattress to stop me from rolling out of bed. The fridge is anclent and every 20 minutes it let out a shudder and a loud clang so I had to switch it off. At 4am when guests who had been at the AC/DC concert were stll straggling in and making unreasonable noise I gave up any attempt to sleep and decided to jump in my car and get an early start for the long drive home. Unfortunately the underground garage gate did not open so I had to wake the night clerk to get him to flick a switch to raise the gate. I was abused by him for not planning my departure properly, he felt that I should have known that the slanting bed and noisy fridge would mean I would want to get up four hours earlier than planned. He wanted to know why I had not told the noisy guests to quieten down so obviously he felt that this was not his responsibility. I had left my key in the room expecting to make a quick getaway and not to bother anyone but this was not acceptable to him, he told me to go back to the room and get the key. I had to explain to him that I could not get in the room because the key was inside, he grumbled a bit more and then started whinging to me about interrupting his sleep. Eventually he agreed to flick the switch so I went to my car and waited for the gate to rise but this took almost two minutes which I take was his way of proving that he was in charge and he was doing me a favour in letting me leave. I had stayed at this motel in 2003 but found the service so disgusting this time I would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: cabquokka
Reviews.Content: While very basic, this hotel is great value for travellers on a budget. Sure you can find minor faults if you want to be picky but it was clean and acceptably equipped. Three of us stayed here in a triple room and for $99 instead of $270 elsewhere it wasn't a contest. Staff were polite and helpful. Just want a bed for a few nights this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Rude staff ( Some)”
Reviews.Author: pralaksh
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK as far as night stay is concerned. However, does not have any restaurant etc. The room was not cleaned one day out of three days. One of the lady staff at the counter is too rude / non cherrful for being in the hospitality industry. Does not know how to talk to kids and even made passes comments.

Reviews.Title: “ok for who likes walking after a long day”
Reviews.Author: Akl79
Reviews.Content: Location is ok, not so far from the station. 10mins walking. The room looks all right except some big dusts and hairs on white tiles in the bathroom everyday. They sell Wifi hourly. ($5) The fridge makes a big noise every hour that makes me wake up. The owner couple is rough, casual friendly to me. I saw the arguments sometimes with Indian family. It was not very nice at the entrance. The reason I booked was I like calm and quiet. And I read reviews on this site. But people walking around in the hotel and staff talk early morning to night. (no lift, hall way with tiles) Other people smoke outside of my room. Next time I would stay at YHA or something.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: JenniePearl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to New Zealand and on the way back to the UK. Our room for the first part was on the third floor which was a bit of a nightmare with all our luggage and no lift!!! Having said that the room was really clean and the bed was extremely comfortable! Chris and Vicky were very friendly. The front door is locked and only guests had a key which meant we felt totally safe. It is a bit of a walk from the railway station but that didnt hurt us! When we stayed here on the way back we had a first floor room which wasnt so bad with the luggage! Again it was very clean and comfortable. We would stay here again next time we visit Sydney and would recommend this hotel to anyone we know. The hotel rate was reasonable and for a small fee we could get the intanet which was great for emails etc!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, safe and close to the city”
Reviews.Author: tinzaroo
Reviews.Content: We were three siblings who needed a room with three single beds. They were able to accommodate us for a very reasonable price. The rooms are non smoking, and we requested a ground floor room as one of our party did not like the idea of stairs, and there is no elevator. The room was very clean and everything worked just fine. It's nice and close to the city and the airport. A taxi from the airport was AUD$25 for two of us, which is cheap. A taxi to the city centre is about AUD$15. We stayed over a weekend, and found it to be pretty quiet. The courtyard outside is a nice area to sit and eat your dinner or to have a ciggie and a beer. The coffee bar nearby makes great coffee and has a good range of food too. There are also a few restaurants within a few minute walk, plus a pub which serves great value pub meals. All in all, it was a great stay and I'd definitely recommend it. The staff are very friendly and accommodating which is always nice :o)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly staff and easy access”
Reviews.Author: M_3_98
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to Sydney and we look for reasonable price and easy access place to explore the city. Within one day we already could figure out how to go places by bus from our hotel. Just straight ahead to circular quay by bus. the rooms was very clean especially top floors (since we experienced stayed at the 3rd and 1st floor) Friendly and helpful staff. I really enjoy my time staying in that place. if you take taxi from/to airport within normal hour it would cost around AUD 20.00 but if it's outside normal hour, it will take about AUD 30.00 (which I think still reasonable). You could also take airport pick up for about AUD 12.00. I would RECOMMEND this place to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative”
Reviews.Author: tony273
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed twice at this hotel and have found it a useful and good-value alternative on the edge of the city centre. As others have pointed out is not especially central or near the railway. It is a self-catering establishment rather than a hotel and there is no food and drink available apart from a vending machine. Shops, cafes and internet are 5 mins walk away. Rooms are reasonably spacious, clean with modernised, though not luxurious, bathrooms. Those at the back are quiet, befitting from old thick walls. There is no lift and the place is not ideal for those with heavy luggage. An annoyance is being asked to pay in advance on check-in. It makes you wonder what sort of place you have come to although the subsequent experience is satisfactory and the management friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: cjocolumbus
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on a leaflet in the Tourist Inofrmation Centre in Sydney. We checked out of our crap place and decided to stay here at the Central Railway Hotel , which was ver acccomondation for 5 of us. We had a family room on the top floor of the complex. This included 1 double and 3 single beds in the room. We bonded as a family. There was vending machines and laundry room on the ground floor. The staff were very helpfull, I think the father of the owner was in charge when got there. I would like to thank them dearly for allowing us to stay with very short notice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPolo21CN
Reviews.Content: Booking/checking in ---------------------------- The front desk is not open 24 hrs, but if you tell the hotel staff in advance, they arrange for the keys to be left at a place where you can find them. Staff ------ Friendly staff (Zelma and John), they enjoy the work they do, this is seen in their service orientation too. Room -------- The rooms are neat and tidy, It does not charge 5* rates, so dont expect 5* rooms. Location ------------ A short walk to the central railway station, china town Lots of different eateries nearby Negatives -------------- The rooms dont have a direct line, so it can be a problem for business travellers

Reviews.Title: “Misleading name”
Reviews.Author: FloJoCornwall
Reviews.Content: This could have had a 2.5 rating if we had the option. We were pretty desperate by the time we identified this hotel for our second night in Sydney - there were few rooms available thanks to Justin Timberlake performing! We wrongly assumed that the words 'central' and 'railway' meant it was near the central railway station (and indeed the blurb suggested this), so when we had to drag our heavy bags for fifteen minutes from the station we began to feel somewhat misled. The buses run fairly frequently to Circular Quay and take about 15/20 mins. The room was clean and quiet with only a fan, but in need of refurbishment (although some may have been upgraded and aircon installed) and the staff friendly and helpful. WiFi access costs 10 dollars for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “All round excellence”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Coming from the country by train, this hotel was placed just right. Rooms were clean (beautiful linen)and provided all you would need. We stayed a couple of nights but would have liked to stay more. Perhaps it is suited to those who prefer a quiet location but was just right for the four of us and the rooms we had did look out over the streetscape and noise was no problem. The courtyard atmosphere out the back of the hotel was extremely pleasant; an ideal place to farewell oveseas visitors who were with us. Altogether, a pleasant and inexpensive venue. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what they offer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a hostel in Sydney a few weeks before our stay in Central Railway Hotel. After our experience there we decided to pay more to get something decent for our money. To be honest, we could have gone back to the hostel. The only difference was that the door to our room had a lock and we had a bathroom in our room. So if you donÂ´t mind hostel atmosphere, but donÂ´t want a dorm room, then save your money and book a double room in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: fishingpaddy
Reviews.Content: Although a ten minute walk from the railway station, this was a nice, clean hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel to stay at...”
Reviews.Author: agfallenangel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room with two friends from September 19-23. Location was alright - about a 10-15 min walk to Central Railway station, which me and my friends only used once during our stay. There is a bus stop about 2 min down the street that will take you all the way downtown. We mainly walked around to Chinatown/Harbour (though it is quite far.. maybe 30 minutes or more?). There are some nice restaurants nearby if you walk towards the traffic lights and turn right (where there is a youth hostel) and go down to the next main street you can see some. There is a really nice Lebanese restaurant (the old man is really cute!) that we found. It is pretty quiet. I think we only saw a couple of guests during our stay. We were on the second floor overlooking the main street which could at times be a bit noisy. The room was decent, although the shower was horrible - no pressure at all! The guy at the front desk (at first seems a bit cold) but is really helpful - he lent us a power adapter for our stay and gave us a new hairdryer (even though I just didn't realise there was a switch on the power outlets you had to flip to access the power). I would stay there again if I had lots of time just to walk around and relax (which me and my friends kind of just wanted to do). Although it did seem a bit expensive (about 100 CDN/night/room for 3).

Reviews.Title: “nice, but too quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: alot further from the central railway station than the name suggests, we were hoping to see sydney by train but resorted to taxis in the end. the room was comfortable,clean and neat and the staff were accommodating. very quiet if you want some peace.

HotelInfo.Name: Central Railway Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 240 Chalmers Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
